review: Overall a good CPK in MDR when I need my BBQ chicken pizza kick.  CPK itself is ~4 star in my opinion with a good selection of pizzas, salads, and other delicious entrees. This location is no different as all of our items have come out consistently well prepared and to the standard we have grown accustomed to from CPK.  My only issue with this location to bring down to 3.5 stars is the significant inconsistency when it comes to service.  Several times we have been there now in which we will only see the server twice, to take order and then to deliver the bill. In the mean time, it was a struggle and we had to bother other staff members for requested items or drink refills.  Again, good place for large groups and family friendly, but would benefit from a little touch up with regards to attention to service.

I'm so disappointed in the service that we had tonight, Ifelt compelled to post a review. Here's the DL on how the night went: 6:30 Sit down at table 6:45 No waiter, no water, ask for waiter/server 6:55 Waiter finally arrives and says sorry for slow service and that a lot of things are broken. Really. 7:00Ask for bread (3 times) 7:10 Order 2 Chicken Milanese and one Garlic Cream Pasta with Chicken sauce on the side  7:40 Get lame excuse for waiter about food not being ready 7:45 Waiter says maybe chicken is done but pasta isn't because they made it wrong and had to remake 7:55 Ask for manager 8:00 Manager comes over and we tell her that our server is inefficient. Acts like she already knows and checks on food 8:10 inept server brings one chicken Milanese and two pastas. 8:15 Finally get all of the food 8:30 Not really hungry any more 8:35 Server gets big attitude 8:40 Manager comps Chicken dishes 8:45 Husband writes "nope" under tip...

We come pretty often and have a few "go-to's" on the menu. Most notably we love the Chicken Tequila , Chipotle Chicken Pizza, Bolognese, Sante Fe Bowl, the Lettuce wrap appetizer, and the Baja Spring roll appetizer. Today we tried something new! My fiancée had the Smashed Chicken Meatball sandwich. The meatballs are made of a blend of chicken and sausage and  are served on a folded thin pizza. So flavorful! This is a new item on the menu and if you didn't try it you would be missing out. I had the "Works" pizza. This pizza has spicy sausage, pepperoni, mushrooms, and green peppers. It sounds a little boring but it is fantastic. The heat from the spicy sausage is balanced well with the veggies. And the pepperoni is extremely tasty!   I would recommend sitting at the bar if you can. The service here is way better and the bartenders are very friendly! Today we had Makuba. We have had her wait on us before and she even remembered us from our last visit! She has excellent customer service, even though she was bartending by herself tonight, with a full bar of seated customers.

The California Pizza Kitchen in Marina del Rey is in a shopping center with a Ralph's, West Marine, Rainbow Health Foods, a Starbucks, See's Candy, the Counter, Sugarfish and other specialty stores. So it is always busy. There may be a bit of a wait during peak times but they have so many tables but it's usually not long. There is a huge parking lot but they share it with so many other places it can be tough getting a spot close.  I really like CPK.  My husband is not a fan (mostly because we've been there when it was busy and it's sometimes a bit loud for him) so I usually only go with friends.  Their Chopped Salad is always my go-to but they had my very favorite-their  Greek Salad (which I didn't see on the menu now though I haven't asked).  Their pizzas are wonderful also-especially since so many choices. I think anything you pick will be good.  I recommend this CPK. It has something for everybody on the menu

A quick run to Venice Beach today and back home tonight. The Marina restaurants are packed and a full parking lot means a wait. So we opted for CPK, a home town favorite. Sat immediately on the enclosed patio, the served appeared right now. Dinner order taken, soup (a vegetable market) very good. A creamy tomato base with plenty of vegetables, served piping hot I enjoyed the Tequila Chicken Spinach Linguini, I asked for the $5 shrimp add on. The flavor was mild no need for the lime with this tequila dish, I was glad I had ordered the extra shrimp the chicken portion was literally five chunks.  P ordered her usual mushroom pizza on thin crust with an alfradp sauce and a white truffle oil drizzle on the side. Nothing special here but a decent meal at a non crowded restaurant, just three stars. If you want real good go to the crowed place and enjoy the wait & meal too. foodguy-Martin

We ordered the thin crust siciliano. Excellent. Opted for no ham and light on the salami. I would order it again and ask for more sauce. The waiter said that was his fav pizza. And I must say, at cpk, that is mine as well. Def get the bbq chopped salad. And def try the baked potato soup.

The food here is TASTY. Their Thai chicken pizza, roasted veggie salad, soups, and carne asada pizza are always awesome.  The service is BEYOND SLOW! Like painfully slow. So don't ever come in a rush or starving.  I saw the manager touch the salad toppings with her bare hands to make her own lunch. GROSS!!! It's an open kitchen!  Please get better because your food is tasty....

This is a great pizza restaurant and I always orders the mushroom funghi pizza with truffle oil on the side. The pizza is thin crust and light so it isn't very filling . One of thee best appetizers I've gotten was the buffalo cauliflower with blue cheese. Oh my goodness, it was so good! Would definitely go back just for that and a Glass did wine.

So i ordered my lunch for curbside pick up and it didn't go through. They had some issues with the system. So i had to wait much longer than i expected. The waiter came out and he was helpful, he rushed my order. Free lemonade is always good. I will be back. Im not sure i'll order curbside anymore though.

Good food! I like the membership program specially when you get a discount and or a freebie (depends on earned points). Curbside order is convenient too, just park and wait in the car   The only thing that I'm not crazy about is sometimes you have to wait for awhile (dine in), the service can be very slow, just like any other restaurants.

I've been to other CPKs and have had good experiences but this location did not match the other locations experiences. The food was good but the service was so incredibly slow. I don't like to complain on yelp but just wanted to give the heads up. It was comical the service was so slow except that it wasn't since I spent $100 leaving pretty annoyed.

Lindsay as a manager you're supposed to put out fires not create one nor a hostile uncomfortable menacing environment/atmosphere. Your tone body language accusations lies and defensive behavior was absolutely uncalled for.... and your threat to call security was classic of a young inexperienced victim mentality. This was embarrassing uncomfortable outrageous and unnecessary.  Grow up and do better leave your personal emotions at the door this CPK needs work. I will give corporate a call for you.  Be well and reconsider your role as a manger.

Party of 12. Wouldn't let us reserve. Was told "we don't take reservations."  Really?  5:30 on a Tuesday. The woman told us to come early. Out if town visitors ... not acceptable when we are coming in as such a large party. LOST OUR BUSINESS TO TONY Ps down the road and closer to the Ritz, our hotel. California Pizza Kitchen you need better rules and service. Very unbending and unhelpful. You lost our $500 check. Too bad for you.

Love getting the jambalaya linguini fini!!! It's not too spicy and it is filled with shrimps, crawfish and sausage. I like ordering it with the penne noodles but either way it is good and they give you plenty.

Came here just for the butter cake! We seated ourselves and as soon as we sat down we was greeted by a waiter who literally just finished eating his lunch. The service was great, the butter cake was amazing, however we ordered some drinks and they weren't as strong as we would have liked, but they were good. The only thing missing...happy hour!! I can't believe CPK doesn't have a happy hour. :/

Great service, great food. Have never been disappointed with a CPK yet, and I've tried them across the country (not that I'm looking for a disappointing CPK).  Tonight I ordered the BBQ chicken pizza, Wild mushroom pizza and Chipotle spicy chicken pizza,  all made in wheat bread and thin crust upon request, thanks to our generous server Liam. These portions were sufficient in dinner for five very hungry people. I also ordered the season special Watermelon mint martini and Honey bee lemonade. I couldn't get the martini in skinny, but it was super yum; even ordered a refill.    All the three pizzas were very tasty. The chipotle chicken pizza came with a cilantro lime dip that made it stand out among the three pizzas. I'd rank the bbq chicken pizza second simply for the love of bbq sauce.  On a Wednesday night, the crowd was light and we were out of there in tops an hour and fifteen.

Kept me waiting even though I was ready. It wasn't too busy of a day and I felt as if I was ignored. I'll give benefit of the doubt because there might have been other reasons for the lack of immediate service.  They should tend to the needs of every individual more often instead of stopping at the same table, getting their order right even if they are halfway done with their meals. I stepped in for 15 minutes and continued to wait even when I asked for my server. I will assume the location here tends to be slower but some more effort should be put into the needs of all customers, not short stopping. Overall though the taste of CPK is fine. Had tried out their new chicken entree they were promoting and it wasn't too dry. 3 stars mainly for the service.

Called ahead and placed my to go order, only to show up when they said it would be ready and have the lady in takeout tell me my order wasn't in the system. I got no explanation or apology, she just asked if I wanted to place an order there at the counter. I then had to wait the entire duration for the food to be prepared as if I hadn't ever called in the order, and the employees gave no apology, but instead insinuated that it was my fault and that I must not have called in at all. Very frustrating.
Place is not all that, pizza is ok here but their entrees are salty and just average! Go to a real italian spot if u gonna go here.

History seems to repeat itself! Gave CPK a second... then a third... and then a fourth chance. Ironically, all of the outcomes were the same when ordering from a food delivery service. The food never came, or was 2 hours late!  Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.
New management brings lower quality.  Bar cut down to minimal choices.  Tito's and Grey Goose only choices and we hate both! Cutting back on quality guarantees we won't be back!

I've been to this location a few times before and most recently after a concert at Chace park. Sat at the bar and could see the chefs making pizzas and the bartender mixing drinks.  There was a big TV screen on with soccer on. Our bartender was super friendly. I wanted to try the Sangria - they had white and red and I ended up getting the flight of three which was only $10.  I tried it and the red was probably the best one.  Didn't eat on this visit but the pizzas are usually pretty yummy. It was fun to see them cooking them.

Just finished eating here with my friend. We usually like CPK But this location was something else. Our waitress Itzayana only came to us to drop off our food. We got heavy meals so we finished our drinks fast and we didn't get a refill until we were finished with our meals. My friend also asked her for water and that was never brought to her. At the end we were annoyed of her service and I'm sure she could tell but she was unapologetic and rude.

Everything here is OVERPRICED. You are paying for super average and mediocre food. I ordered the zucchini fettuccini, and there was more zucchini in it than there was pasta (the pasta was way undercooked too). Also, the plate they put it in is only like an inch from bottom to top, meaning you're paying 17 dollars for about 3 bites of food? NOT WORTH IT. Also, their pizza's crust is soft and not even as good as something as cheap as Little Caesar's pizza.

Awful!  That sums it up.  The service was so-so, but the quality of food is terrible now.  The chicken in the BBQ chicken salad seemed old and precooked for a while, and the flavor of the salad is different.  Others with me were unimpressed or criticizing as well.  The last time I was here I said I'd try once more, and now never again!

I've been going to CPK since I was a kid, and I've always loved their food. They recently underwent a transformation, and it was a complete upgrade! CPK now has a more upscale and trendy vibe while still staying casual and family friendly.  Today, I shared the California veggie pizza with my lunch mate and had a Thai crunch salad for myself. The pizza came first, and to my surprise, it was lukewarm -- as if it had been sitting a while. CPK usually brings its pizza still sizzling from the oven, so I was disappointed that it had been left out and cooled down.  My thai crunch salad was awesome as usual. I never go to CPK without getting this salad. I love the complex textures from the edamame, peanuts, crispy lettuce, and wontons. The dressing is light but flavorful, just the way I like it! Overall, we had a positive experience. The staff was warm and friendly, and service was quick.

I've actually been to this location 2 times this week with different friends!!! Both times I used the current coupon of getting one item free when another item for $15.00 is purchased. What a great deal! Both times, we have shared the pizza & salad. There are even leftovers for later on! I went to another location with another friend last weekend & had a good experience. I like this location because of the service & ease of nearby parking. All in all, another great experience at this location once again. :) :)

This was our first time visiting a California Pizza Kitchen.  The service was great and the food was pretty good.  I need to try it once more before I can give it a thorough review.  The location was great, but I didn't taste anything that was overwhelming.

I'm a big pasta fan and I've got to tell you the quick service staff at the marina Delray location is just as perfect as the weather.we're going to be coming back many times. Get the lunch started here and enjoy!!

I usually come to this CPK because it's close to home and service was good.  But today our server Isa was so rude and racist. I went in with my two toddlers and husband for lunch.  She would skip our table and go to the white people next to us and ask if they needed anything in a polite manner but wouldn't even ask if we needed anything.  She never offered us refills or if we needed anything. She was just chatting away with her coworkers. She finally brought us the bill after 10-15 minutes of waiting for her. It was just bad and slow service today. So sad to see how you can ignore someone that's the same race as you

I love their small bites menu! Its perfect for a quick lunch and a beer. Got good service every time I have come, and while this particular location isn't in my neighborhood anymore, I don't believe it has changed much. One thing that I particularly likes here is that I was able to get in / out during my hour lunch. You can't do that at every restaurant!  The only bad thing here is the parking. But that really isn't CPK's fault but the locations.  - Bottom Line...you need lunch and in Marina Del Rey, come and eat here!

I noticed there are several negative reviews for this location but we have always had a great experience.  CPK is always a crowd pleaser for my kids and their friends, and also for me!  There's something for everyone, the food comes out fast,  and is always tasty and fresh.  I usually order the thai chicken pizza or a salad, and my kids get something off the kids menu.  There's a decent wine list as well, and lots of appetizer options.  We usually come here at least once a month and will continue to do so!

My daughter and I went to this location last week it was really busy we got seated within a few minutes. I ordered the salad with the strawberries and watermelon and it was epic. She ordered the macaroni and cheese about  1/4 of the way through I saw her pulling out what looked to me like stringing cheese from her mouth but it was a piece of string.  We notified the server and he quickly apologized and offered her something else. She ordered the same and they brought her a new one.  The manager came over and apologized as well and she explained it was a piece of the chefs coat. We finished up and when we got the check they charged us full rate for everything. I would expect to at least get the macaroni and cheese comped. Not sure of their policy I paid the bill and we moved on.  I emailed corporate the next morning and told them of the situation I also said don't send me anything free I just want to know your policy on these types of things. Well I've received no answer from them whatsoever and that really bums me out. So hence the reason for the low rating. I really don't think I'll be back.

This has to be the worst CPK in the entire chain. I have been a CPK customer for 30 years beginning with the one that used to be in the Golden Nugget in Las Vegas. I had so many service issues with the Marina location that I have been driving several miles out of my way to eat at the on in Culver City even though I can walk to the Marina location but tonight I decided to give the Marina another try. I am not going to get into all the details except to say how it ended. The waiter took away my son's main course to box it up and never brought back the box. When I asked him about it because we had waited for a long time after being ready to leave he said, "You said you didn't want it."  Huh? No apology, no offer to remake or take it off the bill, no nothing except a belligerent attitude. I hope the fleas of a thousand camels infest this hell hole of a place.

Coming here at dinner was probably a mistake, service was lacking due to being busy. They do have a descent menu that goes beyond pizza and offers soups, salads,apps and pasta dishes. My salad was descent, the salmon not the best quality. Soup overly salty as were most of the items we tried. You can tell the food is mass produced, it's missing freshness and spices. Not horrible, but I wouldn't bother to return.

I know going to California and getting this may not seem ideal to some like going to Texas and going to Texas Roadhouse but in my opinion why not visit in state if you love it.  My wife needs to eat gluten free and their pizza is always a good choice. This was the best California Pizza Kitchen we have ever been to. The gentlemen making the pizzas was top notch. I ordered the GF grilled chicken, scallions Pizza and my wife had the gf margarita and we split a Caesar salad. Had the most generous cheese serving we have had there and the crust was flawless. We have had at many different cities and this was far above. Do yourself a favor and try it out!

Hadn't been to CPK in a few years.  Wow!  Has it gone downhill!  Took two hours to have a normal lunch because service and food prep was so ridiculously slow.  Ordered my old favorite, the Moroccan Chicken salad.  Tasted like the kitchen had used straight vegetable oil as the dressing.  Yuck.  Sent it back (timing mistake, as salad #2 arrived while my companions were finishing their desserts!)  Second salad was inundated with dried cranberries (why?) which was amusing since they were so stingy with the Marconi almonds -- I counted four.  And why the obviously canned beet bits?  For $11.99? Oh yes.  The dressing.  The original reason for send-back.  This time they gave the vegetable oil a "slight" acidity and called it "dressing" (notice emphasis on "slight.")  On reflection I still can't figure out what they did to the chicken to make it so rubbery.  I wonder if they bring it in pre-made and warm it (?) as it did NOT taste freshly made.   Sigh.  Another chain restaurant bites the dust.  So sad. . .

The staff all around are very very good! I have eaten here since they opened in MDR  The quality of the food is good but my last visit shocked me when I pick up my regular order, Half a Cobb salad and the price is only recently almost the salad price as the whole one ‼ Could it be the Jacked up rent from Caruso  I do know the price is the same every where but  I no longer can pay your price anymore!! Back to making my own as well as the dressing ! Sorry CPK you too are now way overpriced ‼

We had  avocado corn salsa w chips Tortilla spring rolls Roasted chicken w potatoes Chicken Milanese w arugula Split pea soup Wedge salad Everything was fresh and tasty. The chicken Milanese was the best of the bunch.  Service was on the slow side, especially considering that the place was half empty on a late Thursday afternoon.

Food at CPK last night was ok, nothing special.  But the service by Marcus was horrendous. He never refilled our water, not even once, in the 1 1/2 hours that we were at CPK. He took our order without writing it down, then came back 5 minutes later and asked us to repeat our orders. When he served our food, 4 of the orders were right and the 5th was wrong.  If he can't remember what we ordered, why doesn't he write it down? He rarely came to our table, and never came back to ask if everything was ok or if we needed anything else. We had to request an extra order of bread 5 times before he finally delivered.  He explained that it was the kitchen still baking the bread, so I'm not sure who's fault that was, but nevertheless service was 1 out of 5 stars.

Gotta give credit when credit is due. We dined in at this location- California pizza kitchen is one of my favorite restaurants! We had an amazing experience from the moment we walked in. Our server, Liam was one of the best servers I've had at CPK, he was very attentive and friendly. Our glasses were always full, food was brought out quickly... He was on point! The food was so delicious (as always) I got the tostada pizza- sounds a little weird, but by far my favorite thing on the menu.  Next time when we were in town, we will definitely stop in and dine again!

My family and I have been long time patrons of CPK. We usually frequent the locations in Encino and Glendale and the food is fresh and service always on point, seldom do we have any issues.  I went to this location recently because I was in the area.  We ordered a pizza and it was super salty! I let the server know and he tried to tell me that I was wrong, I told him we didn't want it and they made a new pizza.  The manager (female) of this location was initially snarky and unapologetic.  They made a new pizza that was super oily! I was dissappointed that this happened, but from the other reviews it looks like I am not the first person complaining that the food is salty and managment being rather condescending.  CPK please work on improving the food and most importantly the service at this location.

This is a 3.5 star rating really, but I'm giving and extra 1/2 star for the lovely service we had from China and her trainer. CPKs are pretty bog standard with a good variety of pizza and American food. They just had a revamp and the place looks more open than it did before with tall bar tables at the back. Their special cocktail (it was a sangria with elderflower) was super delicious and I had a few of them. We ordered the spinach dip appetizer and the veggie roll appetizers. Spinach dip was good, quite cheesy, and the veggie egg rolls had a nice crunch to them. For lunch I split the salmon summer salad (had watermelon in it!) and the lobster flatbread. The lobster flatbread was more of an appetizer, but it had a lot of lobster on top of the flatbread so points for that. The summer salad was really good and I liked the creativity of the watermelon in it. The salmon in the salad was a bit overcooked.  I've been here before and I am going to stick with the pizzas here next time. Otherwise the rest of the food was good as usual and really enjoyed the banter with our servers.
Always busy but you get served quickly!  The wait time is never too long.  Hostess was pleasant and that's a plus

Just like any other CPK taste-wise, but this restaurant is big! It's located in a cool plaza, so I liked that we were able to take a stroll in the plaza's boutiques and shops after eating at this CPK and digest our food. Our server, Thomas, was very nice, friendly, and attentive. We were initially seated inside, but per our request, we were able to move to an outside patio area. Loved that they were accommodating! We got the Original BBQ and the Works--both of which were good, just like at any other CPK. Thomas constantly refilled out lemonades too, which was awesome despite the large number of tables he was handling at the time. The great service made for a great time with good food!

I called in an order this evening at 5:10pm for curbside pick-up as I usually do. No issues with the order, I even provided my rewards number. I arrived at 5:45pm and the representative had no record of my order. She proceeded to ask if I called the correct CPK. I pulled out my phone log to show her that I in fact had called the correct number. After checking a total of 3 times, she informed me there was no record of my order. After driving out of my way through terrible LA traffic, I left empty handed. On the way home, I called the number again, and they were able to find my order immediately!! What in the world is going on with CPK??? Very disappointed CPK.

Not a good experience. The staff was not warm or friendly. Took forever to get someone to even acknowledge us. Seems like the staff is just standing around talking most of the time, and there doesn't seem to be much care for the customers or the service they are providing. The food was ok, but much better at other locations. I'll skip this Location next time I'm craving some CPK.

Typical CPK but the service was great. I came late night and got the Thai Pizza which is a safe choice and got the butter cake for desert and was blown away by that. I am a fan of the overall cleanliness as well. Good chain restaurant food.
Way better than I remembered and much better than you probably think. My mother-in-law dragged me to CPK... It's great! Get the Thai chicken pizza.

I have NO IDEA WHATSOEVER why this place is only rated 3 stars on Yelp! The food is great, the service is great, prices are okay, - but what do you expect in a place like this? - pretty much everything is great! I loved everything, and so did my family. Probably my favorite italian-ish place and Im definitely coming here again!!!

Worst worst worst service I've experienced in my entire life. Order wasn't placed and 45 minutes later we were informed there was a computer glitch. My four year old son was soooooo hungry at this point. It was a sad sight to experience my son so hungry. My 4 month old baby had napped and before the food even came woke up so I of course didn't even get to enjoy my food. Besides the point it took years for husband to get the dressing for his salad. He was almost done with it before it finally came and we asked our server for it three times and finally asked someone else. Soooo horrible. Never coming here again. This would be zero stars if possible!
This place is yummy, good food good drinks. But limit to 3 drinks sooo but you get your full 2 ounces!! Yeah im definitely coming back here. Lvoed it

The worst service I've ever gotten at a CPK, but not the worst service I've EVER gotten.  Newly remodeled, but can I say that the layout is awkward AF?? There's a little bottom annex area with tables and booths that is separated from what I assume is the main dining area - the annex is where I was seated. It was beautiful and well lit, but the waiter in charge of our table looked like he was struggling to attend to the people sitting above us in the main dining area and us at the same time, as he had to go around a long wall.  First off, we weren't given bread. Who does that. I come to CPK expecting bread immediately. Didn't realize this until halfway through my meal when I finally pinpointed why I was feeling empty during the initial seating.  Second of all, it took almost 15 minutes to get crushed red pepper for my pizza. I'm sorry, but there are maybe 10 occupied tables and among 4 waiters manning the floor, it took you that long to bring red pepper flakes? I was halfway done with my pizza when they finally came.  Overall, not a great experience. The pizza was standard, and my waiter wouldn't look me in the eyes or show emotion on his face. Probably will hit up Fresh Brothers next time I decide to get pizza in my life in this area.

We dined here back in May and had a very positive experience, we have since moved to the LA area and went back again for lunch.  Our waitress was very friendly and attentive.  Our food came out quickly and tasted great.  We each had a different type of pizza and enjoyed it.  We had the Red Velvet Cake and Strawberry Shortcake for dessert, it was delicious as usual. Now that we live in the area, we will likely be back to this establishment.

I placed a takeout order earlier this afternoon. A full roasted veggie salad with chicken, my usual order. It was my first time trying this location. When I got home, I could barely swallow my first bite. It was INCREDIBLY salty. So I drove all the way back to the restaurant to demand a refund for my uneaten, salty salad. The manager, Urtha (I think), was rather unapologetic. She said someone in the afternoon shift made a bad batch of stressing, granted me a refund, and sent me on my way. I'll have to tell work about my bad experience (we order their catering every so often). CPK, you've lost a loyal customer.

Edgar was a great server!! Our three pizzas were wonderful---Sicilian, Chicken with spinach, artichokes and garlic, and California Veggie with goat cheese. I also had a California Crush cocktail. Tangy and refreshing! Finally, for dessert we three shared  a fresh, seasonal strawberry shortcake with Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream and a slice of  key lime pie. Fabulous!!

For starters, anyone who has been to the plaza knows how parking can be. For those who don't - just know that you'll want to practice patience looking for parking while navigating around others who seem oblivious to the fact that they're holding up traffic and creating a log jam, in an already packed parking lot.  As for the restaurant, there's both indoor and outdoor seating. One the chillier nights, I've seen a lot of empty tables because no one want to be out in the cold when the marine layer starts creeping in. It's warmer and cozier indoors and you don't have to deal with the vehicular noise from the parking lot.  Then there's the service. On this visit, our server seemed to either be slow, or just didn't care to serve our table. I can't be sure which it was but to have to ask to be served, when I thought that's the primary function of the wait staff - just didn't calculate right for me. No follow up to check on how the dishes came out nor whether we wanted anything else. We also had to flag her down for the check after she walked by us several times, checking up on the tables around us.  The food was okay. I tried the Tequila Lime Fettucini and there definitely is a lime flavor. Too much in fact. It took away from the rest of the dish so keep that in mind and ask for less if you decided to try it yourself. If you like a heavy lime presence, then this is the dish for you. My family seemed to enjoy their orders. The only comment I heard was that the wild mushroom pizza could have used more mushroom, and possibly less cheese. I didn't try the other dishes on the table so I'll just leave it at that.  It's a chain restaurant so we should all know what to expect. On this occasion, my experience was okay though it might have been a little better had the service been better too.

I love it here!!! The staff is super friendly and always gets our food to us in a timely order!! Their drinks are always really good. We usually get the salmon and a classic pizza. Always a solid dinner spot

Dissapointed with food quality. Cheeze, sauce an chicken were skimpy on both pizzas.  Salads not as generous as in the past.  Had to sit with cooling pizza while mistake on order was corrected.  Not at all as good as our past experience with CPK.

This place is very much MEH. I use to order there food to go in S.F and loved certain dishes, so once I moved to the area and saw a CPK was near, i was excited to try it out. Both time no one greeted us, and when they did it seemed like it was a chour for them.  1st time: they forgot my moms entree, but the guy took it off the bill at least.  The waiter was nice, but i think just over worked so we had little attention. 2nd time: Waiter didn't really help us with anything. Took about 20min to get my drink, and then didn't ask what we wanted to eat. Strange. So i had to grab him when he walked by, which was seldom. He didn't check in even once during out meal, in the end we had to walk to him to get the check in order to leave. Not the end of the world stuff, but also pretty easy stuff to change on there end. Weird vibes there.

We recently ordered from here to cater dinner at work. I ordered the cedar plank salmon and a Waldorf side salad. The salmon was awesome and the portion was just right. :) The salad was pretty great also and they have a gluten free option!!  Will be ordering this again next time !

I used to come to the CPK often since it was closest to where I lived, let me just tell you my disappointment. Often times the food comes out cold or not fully cooked. I understand that I'm not signing up for fine dining but I still expect good quality. The one plus is the majority of the staff is really nice. My last visit there the waiter forgot about us for a long time as we waited for our check. I suggest going to  different CPK!

My mother and I came here parched from walking aroundVenice for hours. Michael, or as he says his French name is Michae, was our server. He was very nice and entertaining until my mother got a little too inappropriate. The pizzas were decent and drinks were quite nice. My mother apparently had 2 too many drinks as she asked Michael to come home with her.  I mean, he's nice looking and all, but about 20 years too young for her. Any ways, overall nice experience. Good food. Excellent service. Great drinks.

The service was horrible. Marina was our server, and I don't think she smiled once while we were there. She seemed to have a huge attitude. As a server myself I try to give the server the benefit, but she ruined our experience. We couldn't get out of there sooner. She forgot our appetizer, didn't apologize just asked if we still wanted it. We had already finished our entrees. She sat it down, it was cold. We told her and she just took it back no apology no offer to make a new one.  Maybe she thought we were a waste of her time, because that's how she made us feel.  I won't stop going to CPK, I just would never sit with her again and wouldn't go back to this specific location. Management should remind her that as a server you're suppose to make a guests experience good so they come back and they tip  you! The Kung pao spaghetti was great!

I recently dined at the Marina Del Rey location and was extremely impressed with the level of customer service that I received by a food server named Alexandra. Alexandra was attentive and was extremely knowledgable with the menu which made my decision making a whole lot easier. She was warm, genuine and truly seemed to care about her customers dining experience. If all food servers shared her positive attitude, there wouldn't be an empty chair in any food establishment! I really cannot say enough about this young lady. Her  customer service alone is the reason why my family and I will be back to this location! 5 *S*T*A*R*S* for service!! 4 *S*T*A*R*S*  for the food. They made some drastic changes to the menu and there is less of a selection. If you stick with the pizza you won't be disappointed. My chicken penne was slightly over cooked and just meh....Management was kind enough to replace it. I wish I could remember the manager on duty that night. He was just as delightful as Alex. Hopefully they will bring this chain restaurant  to what it once was, It would be a shame if they didn't..
Ordered food via Grubhub - website promised delivery within 35 mins (we are only a 5 min driving distance from the Fiji way location) - been 90 minutes and still waiting. Don't order from this place.

Wowzer. CPK has gone WAY downhill!   Service: really s l o w !  Food!: dry, salty, overcooked, cheap tasting!   Overpriced, overcooked, bad food.  We used to go here weekly.  Since they have "reimagined" their menu, we have only been disappointed with it!   Too bad.

After getting seated with our table of six our wait person introduced himself "Bobby" and off we were to what was a great afternoon of fellowship with friends!  When it came time for us to place our order that is when things went down hill.  Bobby took our orders and upon completion placed them with a smile.  He read them back correct but the order arrived incorrectly to my hubby and myself.  We ordered the roasted garlic chicken with seasonal vegetables.  OUR simple request was for the chicken to come with crispy skin as we love that crunch you get with chicken.  Bobby brought my hubby and I the chicken picata with crispy fried skin.  HOW DID THAT HAPPEN?  We shook our heads no and off they went to "quickly" correct it.  Well the train had left the track as our guests ate and we dined on the bread and our drink while  the manager walked past us over a dozen times getting plates of food to everyone but not taking ownership of the situation.  She (the manager ... can't remember her name) did take control of the situation when we cancelled the order period.  That is when the train wreck occurred as her managerial skills were not working to diffuse the situation.  She approached our table with condescension and pretty much "demanding" we take it as they were not charging us.  After going back and forth, we were not charged (as stated) and took the food so as not to waste and she even sent us with a dessert.  Could it have been handled better?  Absolutely!  Will we be back?  Absolutely not. P.S.  The meal actually was not that good.

CPK is just like any other chain restaurant in my mind. It's like TFIG or Applebees except this place had way more children in it than any other restaurant I've been to. With the said, this place isn't the worst but also not the best. The food was good, nothing spectacular but exactly what I expected.  I do like the location of the restaurant and the ample parking. That's a necessity in Los Angeles :)

had a great meal at this.location earlier this week....and now at LAX Southwest terminal and sit down to order just to learn NO KIDS MENU.....really CPK? about to get on a flight with my 4 year old but i have to buy a full size $18 pepperoni pizza that he will never finish...all because there is NOT ONE kids option - in the Southwest terminal where there are tons of kids!! shame on you CPK.....i will think twice before visiting your neighborhood locations in the future.....

Always a guaranteed delicious meal. I know no matter which location i go to, the food is going to be good and the servers are always nice :) The only issue we had, is they kinda forgot about us after we were seated. Also, some of the food we ordered never came out and no-one really checked in on us throughout the meal (we needed settings, napkins, water, etc).The manager wasn't very warm about the mistakes, but the server was a sweetheart so no harm in the end.

Arugula and quinoa salad with chicken breast was so refreshing! You can also order it with salmon as well. Chicken was soft, tasty and warm.  Got the full portion but was a little too much for me. Half is just right. Good avocado spring rolls as well. Comes with two sauces. Preferred the orange one better.

Although we've been to this location before, parking can still be a challenge. However, hostess seated us right away. Clean, attentive and good service. Salads were fresh and delicious. Waldorf salad was better than expected and Brussels flatbread was authentic and satisfying. Most important was the engaging company in attendance!

From the times Ive been here the service has been pretty average.  No real complaints but my expectations have never been exceeded either... its a CPK it is what it is. People must like it, its been around for a long time. I think people come here because hey know what to expect, they know what they like etc. Not much on the menu as far as what I feel are good food options but I do like the Guac and chips starter and the Grilled Veggie salad. It would be great if they carried some better, tastier, healthy options but it is what you would expect from a chain restaurant.

Server overwhelmed. Salads underdressed. Portion of chicken too small and manager tried to explain their portioning method to me.  Surprise I'm a former manager of several cpk's so save your phony explanations for someone else.  Just listen - then apolgize and then make it right.  How about doing a proper line check and we wouldn't have these problems.  Table next to me is sending their food back bc it's cold.  What's up with this kitchen. My recommendation eat elsewhere. Funny- On my out of the restaurant the mgr was getting an earful bc someone's To go order was messed up.

Fast seating on a Sunday night, yay! Our server was friendly and approachable, but appeared perhaps either overwhelmed or spread to thin with coverage, as there were large delays between check ups, refills, etc. While my stuffed chile relleno looked tasty, it arrived to my table, cold. Cold cold. My friend's pizzas were also not hot, just bordering on warm, but didn't want to wait longer for their food and said it was tasty. My husband's thai pizza was abundant in peanut sauce as a base, so he was happy. It took six minutes to find our server and tell him the dish was cold. Thankfully the new one arrived much faster and hotter than the first, and it was a decent execution of a stuffed pepper. Nothing super impressive about the dish, but certainly edible and for under 650 calories, worth trying.  Drinks commonly stayed empty until we would flag our server for a refill.  Glad I tried this location since it's close to my house, but most likely not returning unless in a pinch for places to eat.

It's CPK, so of course the food is tasty. My problem is with their curbside service. If I'm ordering curbside, it's because I'm in a hurry. When I placed my online order I requested a 7:30 pick up time. I arrived at 7:35 thinking they'll have it ready. The last time it took them over 10 min to bring out the order and I had to go in and get it. Well, as luck would have it, it's been 15 min and I'm going in to get my food. And even though I put my reward number in they didn't give me my credit. Since I don't have time to wait for a manager to come over so they can cancel and ring in the order again, I said to forget it. And yes, I'm typing all of this at the restaurant as I wait. Get it together CPK MDR!!!

I had a lovely dinner tonight at the bar. The food was great. The server was very attentive and friendly. Jambalaya penne and the salted caramel pudding. This location has really stepped it up. As a bonus, the Lakers game was on and they won!

Food came out as described in the menu. Friendly and efficient service. I let the server know that we we in a hurry and he had the food and check on the table for us in great time.  I will definitely be back for their roasted veggie salad.

We ordered food from this CPK using Door Dash last evening.  The lettuce in the Caesar salad was aged, and both orders of salmon were burned and tremendously over salted. The food here has been declining for a while now, so this closes it out.
The vegetarian pizza is out of this world the tortilla soup is amazing you can always count on Fresh quality food.

Talk about take out madness. Minus 1 star because it took forever to get our food. We ordered a pizza and 2 salads and then went to Ralph's to pick up some milk. Well we got back and they were not even close to being done.  Tip: call in your order ahead of time and do curbside pick up!!  Our favorites are the meat lovers pizza, the carne Assad pizza, and the Cobb salad. I've never actually eaten in so I can't comment on the table service or cleanliness. Parking is fairly simple. Drive around a few times if you don't see anything right away.  Great location near the marina and Chace park!

It will never cease to amaze me why people frequent CPK. On a whim we decided to grab a quick lunch here after a favorite of ours down the street was closed for the afternoon. We were ignored by the rather surly hostess upon arriving and just decided to find ourselves two spots at the bar. The bartender was nice but incredibly busy and ended up taking down our basic martini order wrong and bringing us something entirely different. The food was basic and needed seasoning. I had the chicken tequila fettuccine. The hubby had a bbq chicken sandwich. My pasta was cold and barely had any chicken. The hubby said his sandwich was boring. Also, CPK is definitely overpriced for what you get.

I went there to order something to go for the lunch party a week ago, but they were unbelievably mean to me. I'm not a native English speaker, so I was trying to understand what a girl at the take out cashir said. Then a guy next to her laughed at me and answered to cashir's questions before I get what she meant all the time. Finally I told him not to answer to her questions since it was MY order. Is that how they treat their customers? No way! They don't even worth a one star.

Went to CPK during a weekday lunch with a few coworkers.  Appetizers For this, we ordered, artichoke dip. It came out warm with sides of chips. I quite liked it, and found I had to stop myself from eating and ruining my lunch. Entree Since they are famous for their pizza, i decided to get the white cheese pizza and added an additional topping of mushroom. I was quite pleased with it, not too crazy about the tomatoes, but it actually worked well together. It didn't overpower the plate. Portion Their pizza size is not too huge, but it will definitely fill you up, with maybe a little leftover. Sharing it may not be enough, but may work if you order an additional little side. Drinks They will refill your drinks (sodas/ ice teas/ etc). Service Out of the 6 of us, one of the order came out wrong. Our friend had to wait for about 10 minutes for his pizza to come out. He was quite patient about it, thankfully he's not the type to get hangry :) Other than that, our waiter though didn't completely ignore us, also didn't smother us with over attention. Also, the manager came a few time to make sure we are having a good dining experience.  Overall, for the price and experience, I wouldn't go back everyday, but it was a pretty good dining experience.

I am a big stickler for Customer service, and all I got at this location was dis-service! Wait staff didn't care, spoke to manager and she had an attitude. I don't care if the food in the place was to die for, I wouldn't go back to the Marina location if these people paid me. A secret shopper needs to pay a visit here. Unbelievably poor service and attitudes. Way to go CPK!

Sorry that I can only give 2 stars for their salad and pasta. We tried Thai crunch salad and Kung pao spaghetti. The salad didn't get the taste of Thai and the grill chicken has no taste at all. For the Kung Pao spaghetti, my friend thought that if you mix the Kung Pao chicken and orange chicken with their chow main from Panda, the taste would be much better than this. LOL...

CPK, love the service, love the flavored Ice tea, love the salads. For a chain restaurant this place is very consistent and good.  I always ask for the patio under the heaters. Such a varied menu. If you have dietary restrictions they will accommodate you, just ask. I use to take my dad and get stuff that wasn't even on the menu. Great place.  Their curb side pick up is great. You park in front, food comes out to you!!!

CPKs is where we bike TO when we venture out for a bike ride.  Destination CPKs!!!  This is a great location, always good food, always seated quickly, great, great service.. I like! We always grab salads, this day i had the bbq chicken cobb salad, 1/2 order because it's plenty.  But before that i had a cup of tortilla soup with was different this time.  Was more like a bisque this time, not as flavorful as usual.. i seem to remember it being a little chunkier not so blended.. and the flavor (although i devoured every bit of it)

I've been to this CPK many times.  I find the service to be very good.  Always greeted at the door, seated where I prefer, and feel taken care of.  I'm always impressed that the food is so good when this is a chain.   My favorites are tequila chicken pasta, chicken lettuce wraps, most any pizza, most salads, yummy desserts, and good wine selection.  One thing I've noticed is that the "small plates" are now smaller and more expensive which makes me wonder what the point is.  Spend a few bucks more and get full sizes.  I would go to this place several times a week if I could.

Wound up here on Christmas Eve with my mother and brother. I grew up in Venice and we were visiting. My boyfriend and I have become recent fans of our local CPK in San Luis Obispo so thought why not. Choices were limited that night. Same menu. I ordered a cup of the smashed pea soup which I always like and the creamy garlic fettucini with added mushrooms which was also a favorite. Unfortunately this night the dish was not up to usual par that we get in SLO. The pasta was undercooked and dish was just warm. I ate some of it..didn't complain which I should have and paid for it. My brother and mom both ordered pizzas..my brother said the carnitas pizza was great and took it home WITH the side of sauce. My mom had no complaints about her cheese pizza. I told my brother about the incredible sangrias. I usually get the flight with Blood oranged subbed in..He got the blood orange one. Loved it. I for some reason didn't get the sangrias that night. Got something else but cannot remember what it was! Oh well! So I would suggest to this kitchen to double check that pasta cooking..was not pleasant at all!

Under new management as of this summer--Bummer. What used to be a fine place now has served us twice on dirty plates (hair on only one plate one time--could be worse I guess), partially heated up food on ice cold plates, and argumentative middle management. Too bad that we'll be taking the Marina del Rey CPK off our favorites list for good.
Chicken was old and rubbery, couldn't eat it. Really bad service. The waitress lost our credit card. Food was bad! Never going back
Got a togo order..wasn't super hungry. .but still great food and service will update my yelp. .the woman who helped me. ..have to get her name. .she was sooooo kind
Melanie the new manager at CPK was outstanding.  I love CPK, staff are always polite and quick to serve.

Love this place. I've been a long time fan. Everyone is super nice at this location. The California veggie on wheat is my favorite with their classic chop salad. If you want dessert the red velvet or the butter cake is super dangerous. You can not take just one bite.  Gluten free items are growing. Only five pizzas right now guaranteed GF.
Solid. Its like all the other restaurants in its class. Good tasty food that isnt too far outside of the bubble, yet tasty enough that you dont feel like youre in a chain.

They make some things well like some salads but how does a place with pizza in the name mess up pizza? I wanted a thin crust Margherita pizza. The picture looked awesome. What I got looked nothing like the picture and was ice cold. So disappointed it's ridiculous. Probably won't be back again.

We love Cpk pizza! We always get take out because it's such a good pizza to take home, watch tv and munch!  We always get the BBQ chicken pizza  and the Sicilian pizza add pineapple and bacon! When we're feeling healthy I get the chicken wardolf salad with no blue cheese.  We ate in ONCE and it wasn't great. Our water drinks came out like literally 2 mins before our pizza and you know pizzas take a while to cook.   Managers aren't that nice there. One time I came to pick up my pizza, I literally stood there for 10 mins before some one asked if I have been help. The take out guy was like "oh I thought my manager had already helped you" and You would think that because she saw me, didn't acknowledge me, took money out of the cashier and then walked away.... Another time I came to pick up pizzas, the manager was screaming at one of the host about her outfit. You know, in front of like 5 other guests waiting like myself.  But the pizza is sooo good!

I think I've already done a review for CPK in Manhattan Beach but the one here in Marina del Rey is the one we go to most often. These two locations are very interchangeable to us. The quality of the food and service being consistently well above average. But I think in terms of what CPK offers they get things very right. The appetizers pair very well with the entrées which pair very well with the desserts. There is enough variety in all categories that we can always find something that suits whatever mood we're in. And then maybe the most difficult thing is to not offer so many things that it makes it too difficult for someone to decide. And the same can be said for having such a large menu that it makes it too large a task for the kitchen to deliver on the consistency that we really value. These two CPK's truly deliver.

Chelsea was awesome!! friendly, personable, helpful, patient and vibrant. We will ask for her section every time we come here. Love this place try something everyday because everything is delicious. Aria and Michael are two of the most helpful, friendliest, and accommodating waiters. Matt the General Manager was very helpful showed great service.

Wow, what an experience. We have been going to CPK for over a decade and we arrive this evening for dinner. Everything is going well and then we get Edgar as our waiter. We order our drinks and dinner all at once. We are sitting waiting for our bread and dinner and 10 minutes pass , new people are seated and they are serviced right away and meal and drinks delivered promptly and we are still waiting ...15 minutes later we finally get our drinks, no food , no bread,.."more people are seated and served , we get our bread finally, 4 little pieces while others get a full plate of bread. Mind you we are being  patient , we even asked another waited for more bread and he was pleasant however never brought back bread. After seeing about 4 parties being seated and served enough was enough. I don't know what is going on with Edgar but he needs to be retrained immediately or CPK will definitely lose many customers. I have been a loyal customer for over a decade.  I advised the manager we were leaving due to the service and she was kind enough to comp our drinks. She remembered us because we are regulars. We left and came to Alejo's. It was night and day compared to CPK tonight . I will return to CPK because this was a one off however enjoying Alejo's right now. Great service, warm bread, nice wine !!

location: Playa del Rey, Los Angeles, CA
review: My boyfriend and I went here two Sundays ago for lunch. We walked in, and waited a good 5 minutes before someone finally came to seat us. Mind you there were 20 people running around, but no one bothered to seat us, or grab a hostess.  We finally got seated outside. Waited another 5 minutes to have our server finally approach us, put down the menus, and say, I will be right back. Didnt take a drink order or anything. We sat there for 5-10 minutes until I finally told my boyfriend that we were done and not eating there. We got up and left.  With all the competition out there, how are you going to allow a customer to wait an entire 15 minutes with essentially zero service. Everyone who works there seems lost and confused.  We got up left and had a delicious meal elsewhere. Wont be back!

Sorry, only 2 stars; Ordered Garlic Cream Fettuccine. If you want a real creamy dish this may not be the one to order. My sauce was very watery the sauce does not coat the pasta it settles in the bottom of the pan. I was told this is how it is normally made. :(

This place just never disappoints!  The food is always very good and fresh and the staff hits it out of the park every time.  We were discussing how our family would be happy to eat dinner here every night. Of course, not the place I personally would choose for a date night, however, family night, every time.

Hugh was our server and he was amazing. They made Troy's first time to CPK very memorable. If you have not been before try it out. You get a free small plate/app.  The manager came by to make sure our experience was good and we like that.  Thanks for a great lunch!!

These guys were good.  The pizza is better than Domino's Pizza of course. They don't take reservations but when we went it was not too busy.  The place is pretty big so they are able to handle big groups. I tried their White Pizza and didn't like it too much.  The Wild Mushroom pizza was pretty good.  And the carnitas pizza was okay.

My friend and I came in on a Sunday at about 3:00 pm. After we were seated (at a table with no silverware), we waited about 15 minutes without a waiter coming by to offer us something to drink. We had to actually pull the hostess aside and ask her to send us a waiter. Once he arrived, he took our drink orders and we asked for bread. He didn't come back with it, so we asked an additional 3 times. We also had no idea who our actual server was because we had about 3 different ones who came to deliver food and take additional orders. Aside from having no silverware at the table, we only had a vinegar bottle. There was no accompanying olive oil bottle like there was on every other table. The manager actually dropped by our table and asked if he could take our vinegar from us in the middle of our meal. Once we finally got our food (2 salads), we had to ask for silverware to eat them with. The hostess was actually the one who brought us our salads which we thought was extremely strange. By the end of the meal we were just so confused. We didn't even know who our tip was going to since we had a total of about 5 different waiters and the hostess. We waited far too long for everything we ordered. Never had an experience like this at CPK before.

NOT what it used to be, the quality of the food has gone down, portions are smaller and service is, again, not what it used to be.  I used to say "when you go to CPK you never disappointed, always good quality food and service" was sad to see i was wrong when we visited it last week.

Went there for lunch. I can't believe how expensive CPK has become. We ordered a bowl of soup, a full salad and 1 ice tea and it was $40.00 out the door. The service was not so great either, the server looked overwhelmed and couldn't keep up in her station, other servers were having to help her out. We had to ask multiple times to get refill on our drinks, even when she was at our table cleaning up plates. The manager wasn't helping out either, he was helping move tables on the patio... While the server was drowning. I used to work for CPK and from how it used to be when Rick and Larry used to run it has changed dramatically, I appreciate the relaxed atmosphere but  the service shouldn't relax with it, especially if you are raising the prices. I remember how strict everything was and how the management had to do their table touches, and make sure customers were happy. And servers had to follow their 5 steps of service.  But I will say that the food is still good, the Italian chopped is amazing... however, I am not sure about all that new stuff that they are trying to push. I so sad that you got rid of the tiramisu... It was so good! Fist you get rid of the potato leak soup now the tiramisu? What's next BBQ chix pizza?  Very sad to see the direction CPK is going... :(
Food is typical of CPK, but service is incredibly slow. Took almost 1/2 hour just for our non-alcoholic drinks. This is typical for this location
Love this location! Beautiful restaurant in the heart of the marina with a friendly staff and great food. This location has a big bar!

By now almost all of us have been to a CPK. This one is nice because it isn't attached to a mall and has outdoor/covered seating.  I don't get to California Pizza Kitchen as often as I did when it first became a craze, but I've been a fan for a while. The pizzas are delicious and the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine (Spinach fettuccine with chicken, peppers, onions and cilantro in a tequila-lime and jalapeño cream sauce) is a killer pasta.  For pizzas, my favorites are Chipotle Chicken, Tostada, and the White Pizza. The main reason for 3 stars is that yesterday at lunch I had to have two different plates replaced because they were dirty.  The first time was annoying, but the second time it started to get a little gross. The service was reasonably fast and the waiter did a good job of bringing refills when needed. The second reason, I've knocked CPK down a notch is that yesterday I tried two items off the new small bites menu and was disappointed in both.  The Korean BBQ Steak Tacos were especially sweet (why?) and  didn't taste even as good as a Galbi taco truck.  The second small dish (the Mediterranean Plate) was just as lame because there was only about 5 small pieces of bread for the forgettable hummus and tiny greek salad.  I think next time, I'll just stick to the big boys menu. One tip: if you visit this month, they have a promotional game card that you can bring back on your next visit and save between 10% and 50% as long as you don't open the card. Well, ok then.

Not gonna lie, the food here is really good... I got the waldorf salad & it was really good, not too much dressing just how I like it. The portion size was probably good for two even if I got the half size, so their serving sizes are pretty big.  My family & I shared the Wild mushroom pizza w/ truffle oil which was a $1.50 more but IF YOURE A MUSHROOM LOVER, i recommend getting that pizza w/ the truffle oil, trust me... its so good !!  so I mean overall the food is good its just the reason why I gave this place a 3 is because unlike the other CPK restaurants ive been too, this one has poor service.. I dont know if its the waitress we got but they weren't so attentive to us, our waitress didn't get my stepmoms order correct, they forgot to bring my sisters fettuccine sauce on the side... and our waitress basically looked like she was in a rush the whole time. I mean I get that it can get busy at times, but youre job as a waitress/waiter requires you to have the right customer service in a fast pace environment like cpk... well from what ive learned working in the food business.  Food is a plus !! just gotta work on the customer service :)

Service 5, Food 1. Question to the chef: Have you EVER had Real pizza? Italian pizza base supposed to be topped with tomato sauce, and then cheese. What arrived on my plate was not pizza. You might call it Californian cheese bread with gentle drizzle of tomato sauce (not even that!) but not pizza. I've looked at the other diners plates - same thing! False marketing and very disappointing waste of money. Wish I went to the supermarket down the street and bought a frozen one.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here. We were seated outside as it was a nice night, however the ladies next to us were quite annoying as they were very loud. There was another table with a screaming child all throughout dinner. The food was good, and I enjoyed it. The waiter was kind and attentive which was important. However, he was not very good on providing refills on our drinks.
Would have given it a 4 star rating if the waitresses had a personality lol Grest gluten free pizza omg I loved it!

Wow!  They finally changed their bread!  No longer do you get a few slices of cold bread and hard as rock butter.  They now serve WARM bread with a wonderful olive oil/herb mix that is just delicious. The rest of the food was the same old stuff - but still okay.  Our server told us other positive changes are on the way. Check it out!

Been a customer of CPK for years and never get tired of their signature pizzas! The BBQ chicken pizza had always been my favorite. Next the white cheese pizza. For the salads the good old Waldorf salad with fetta cheese, grapes and chicken were my favorite. I like the whole concept of an upscale pizza restaurant. Lots of parking at this location. It's part of a shopping plaza so luckily it's farther away from Ralph's.
Server was nice but they took 30+ minutes for the food to arrive. Was in the area so decided to eat here but not will be seeking out this location in the future.

The pasta here is so fresh and cooked perfectly al dente every single time we go.  I like the fettucine alfredo. It  is always good and the price is always right.  I have not yet had pizza from here but the salads dishes are consistently good.

Broccoli Sundried Tomato Fusilli!!! One of my favorite dishes ever!  Unfortunately, everything else sucks. Service sucks. Salads are wilty. Bread is lame... cold hard bread with hard butter. Other pasta dishes suck. Pizza is overpriced.

Today, I tried  the wild mushroom pizza and the small asparagus and arugula salad. Very good. It's pizza the CPK way.  Always a good  place for a quick  lunch meeting. And by the way, they will always try to accommodate you if you want something not specifically on the menu, such as a different topping, sauce or dressing. And their vegan / vegetarian menus are good.
Good pizzas for reasonable price!!! Try the curb side for pick up... Amazing & fast. Also, spinach & artichoke dip are worth to try.
I usually order a small pizza here before getting on the open party boat a block down before going out to sea to fish.  They are fast and good. Love it!

We discovered that CPK has gluten free pizza!  Not only that, they are aware of cross-contamination which is something all celiacs are terrified of.  So nice for our daughter to be able to eat pizza at one of our go-to restaurants.  Another plus is their servers.  Naomi is amazing.

Very frustrating experience. Used curbside service. When I first got there, there were no open parking spaces. I called the restaurant ask them what their procedure is, when all the spots are taken. I was told by Edgar, I don't know. Let me transfer you to take out. The phone rang for 3 minutes and no one every answered. I drove around the parking lot 2x's before a spot opened. Once I parked, I noticed that there are 6 spots reserved for this and of the 6, I was the only one who actually was waiting for curbside service. The other cars were vacant. I spoke with the manager about it and all she did was shrug her shoulders and say, they must have gone inside. I asked her if she could enforce the rule that it is for patrons who are picking up food only. She didn't seem like she cared what I thought. Overall a terrible experience and I won't be going back.

I've been a patron of CPK for as long as I can remember,  I even worked at one of their locations.  I'm a little perplexed how to sum up my experience. I have kids, I try very hard to keep them in their seat when we are eating, the older kid is a pro while my youngest isn't noisy but he's curious.  He won't go up to people and pull their hair but he does like to look out the window and play. The hostess was having none of my kid's shenanigans, while he stood on the bench seat, she told me that this was not allowed. We were just seated. Christ! Give me a second to put my things down, and talk to my kids to remind them to behave.  On another visit, the waiter was giving us horrible service, no drinks until I had to flag a buser for our ordered drinks.  Our waiter was too just flirting with the table two over to bring us the drinks ordered several minutes ago. Lots of families live in the area, if you aren't nice to the youngest patron, what makes you think we'd pay to eat there.  Lots of restaurants in the area. Food is excellent but the service is poor.

This CPK has been here forever in the Marina del Rey shopping center along Admiralty Way.  The parking is good, even when crowded, and it's a fun crowd of business people and those seeking sun and turf.  No ocean views, but there's a nice outside covered patio area. Almost always get the same thing: bbq chicken pizza and spinach dip.  The spinach dip is creamy, cheesy and warm with tortilla chips.  Do I have to describe the BBQ chicken pizza?  It's the most popular dish they offer.  You know who comes here? Lou Ferrigno. I noticed him because the people at the table behind me were so quiet, I turned around -- and saw Lou signing with his sign language buddy. There are nice shops in the center if you time to shop after lunch.

So disappointed. Ordered curbside service online and when we got there even after their quoted ready time we still waited. They forgot the bread and cutlery but we did get napkins so that was interesting and no bread. Food was mediocre. Pasta was dry could've used much more sauce. I love CPK but this location lets down.

The restaurant is in a shopping center. I was there for dinner. As soon as we were seated, we noticed that it was really dark in the restaurant. The lighting was a little too dim. The waitress was nice, but the service was super slow, so it was frustrating. The salad was dry & lacking dressing. Had to ask for extra dressing to add some flavor. I wished that the service had been a little faster.
I was there last night to pick up my food I like the way the guy in braces pack my food he is always smiling and he always greets people keep the outstanding job Alex

I've been coming to this CPK since 1992, and this is the most disorganized and dirtiest I've seen it. The glass door is filthy, the chair was wet when we sat down, the the booster seat was greasy, my wine glass had smudges all over, a server came to take our order after another server had already done so, and the food hasn't even arrived yet, so let's hope for the best. I shudder to think what condition the kitchen is in. Where am I, Chili's? No, I'm at CPK, and I've always had an expectation. It's not a Michelin star restaurant, but it's always had a certain level of standards. Wake up, management and understand that the people who frequent this strip mall will find this unacceptable and end their patronage.

We are here in forth of July, never had CPK before an loved the pizza! It took about 20 mins and considering the amount of people there that evening, that wasn't bad. Pizza was crispy, not greasy and perfectly seasoned. Last night we wanted to have that delicious pizza again (spinach and asparagus) so ordered from our local one (Santa Monica) and it was totally disgusting, this place has it right!!

The food I got here would have gagged a maggot. I think I just have a habit of ordering an undercooked pizza or something else that makes me sick. My wife tries to warn me to skip the place, but I'm a glutton for punishment.

This review is for the kid's meals only. Good value for some pretty tasty selections, which also have respectable nutritional content.  Here are your best bets: 1) Mac and cheese with edamame - Princess gives this one 5 stars 2) Chicken nuggets - real white meat chicken in large chunks - fresh fried - Princess gives this one 4 and 1/2 stars along with your kids meals, you have your choice of sides, and i always order the fruit, which is always pretty fresh - Princess rating of 4 stars Drink - strawberry or kiwi lemonade

We walked in for lunch on a Friday afternoon and we were met by a friendly host and then by a brunette behind the counter (red pants and a black shirt) who yelled, "mother $ucker!" when it appeared she banged her leg on something. Nice professionalism. The dumplings had a gelatinous peanut sauce and the wine was so flat that they couldn't even tell me when the bottle was opened.   Alex was the one saving grace here. He was our server at the bar and was incredibly friendly and very professional. He's likely the only reason we stayed and the only reason we'd come back vs heading to sushi, pizza or another restaurant in the same parking lot.

I eat here frequently and usually have good service and great food ! But tonight went for a early dinner and was very disappointed with the service ! Our waiter was slow and couldn't care less . Had to wait forever for our drinks and food . Was with a three year old and didn't have all night . The manager did Handle it by comping the meal but they really need better waiters .

I've been coming to this place since the beginning of time. The food is really really good here. It's an oldie but a goodie. You can't go wrong with this place except for one thing......... This time around I'll start off with the negatives.... 1. Negatives: THE FUCKIN' BREAD...... Seriously, I can think of 098098203849023804 places with great bread but only one single place with shitty bread. One may be thinkin' why are you trippin'? It's just BREAD SON.... But no! Think of it this way, this is basically the first thing you eat at the restaurant unless you order an appetizer (I recommend the Sesame Ginger dumplings) but otherwise. The bread is super cold, and super hard. I've been one of those customers who has specifically asked my waiter to heat up my bread but then I found out how they do it and it's too much trouble for them so I just decided to suck it up and deal with their shitty bread.  Positives: 1. The pizza is amazing. I really really like the crush and the amazin' selections. They seriously have so many different varieties! 2. HANDS DOWN THE BEST THING TO GET WHICH IS WHAT I GET EVERY TIME IS THE CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCINE..... OHHH EM GEEE..... It's like an ORGASM IN YOUR MOUTH. The pasta just blends so well together. It's about 1300 CALORIES BUT WHO CARES? I always get diced tomatoes to give it some more "Umph" But seriously kids. This is the real deal. They have good pastas like the Kung Pao Pasta and the regular Creme sauce but the Chicken Tequila Fettucine is like the IN-N-OUT of Hamburgers.  This place has gotten more expensive over the years but it's good to go like once in a while!

This CPK IS THE MOST RUDE CPK IVE BEEN TO, everytime I have been there, their hostesses and waiters/ managers mostly everyone I encountered are very snappy and are rude I wouldn't recommend anyone to this location.... They act like they hate their job and if they work in a restaurant acting in such a nasty way, whoever hired the workers should be ashamed.

Excellent food! Yesterday I tried their mushroom cheese pizza, WOW it was delicious...  My family and I love to eat at CPK, but location is one of the best. The bread here is always fresh and fast customer service.

My friend got me to enter a chain restaurant! Ahhhh! The food: Tortilla "spring rolls" - Basically rolled quesadillas with too much cheese. The difference between the three flavors was overpowered by the cheese. I don't get how these are spring rolls in any context... Decent quesadillas. Avocado club egg rolls - Weird hybrid of a BLT sandwich stuffed inside wonton wrappers. Not a big fan of deep fried avocados -- a bit conflicting. Chopped salad - Iceberg lettuce with salami and basil! I guess they do best with simple here. Wild mushroom pizza - Generous amount of four different types of mushrooms. I think it desperately needs some acidity though. Marinara or pepperoncinis? Cranberry cooler - Club soda with a splash of cranberry juice. And apparently asking for just cranberry juice refill gets charged again as a separate drink. Wtf?? Atmosphere was nice, but packed with kids and college kids discussing the day's afternoon hangovers. Waiter wasn't the most attentive nor very friendly. Generically awesome. A bit overpriced as well. A good reminder as to why I stay away from major chain restaurants. Go, CPK!

I love CPK but I had a horrible experience here tonight. I am a a vegetarian and asked for a salad with chicken on the side for the person I was dining with. They brought us a salad they clearly hand picked the chicken out of and still left shreds of chicken in it. GROSS. Makes me question how they handle their food at all. The waitress was barely apologetic and the staff clearly was inspecting it as if we were lying. I didn't receive the drink I ordered till the end of the meal, again they were unapologetic. On our pizza I asked for half mushroom and same there was sausage clearly on it which I accidentally ate. If I were a more difficult customer I would have made a scene. I just think they should REALLY be more considerate about how they are serving their food. I'm leaving utterly disappointed that no one offered to comp anything or even a discount. I won't be returning and warn those with specific food needs (vegetarians and allergies) to beware of the lack of concern before choosing to dine here.

I have became fan of their Tuscan Hummus served with PITA Bread .. We then ordered a Japanese Eggplant :) Loved the variety and taste ... I would really recommend anyone looking for some change of the regular pizza routine and try something new ... I usually prefer Pan Pizza or thick crust but Loved their THIN crust pizza .. Servers are really helpful and recommend dishes based on your preferences .. Have been to other CPK locations too but this one is amongst the best one being located so close to our place ..

Definitely will be coming back here! My picky 6 yr old wanted pizza so we came here and he loves it! And same goes for me. Got greeted at the door with the lady opening the door for us. The waiter was very nice and courteous. Definitely 2 thumbs up!

Last time I was here we were a big group,  our waitress had no patience and in several ocasions she responded agressively.  She forgot my friends beer and brought it when he was almost done. But the part that hit me the most is that in that place they serve water without even asking, how about the drought, there is a law for restaurants not to do that. I don't like wasting specially water these dry times.  Shame on you CPK.

Great location and very friendly, helpful staff. I want to give a higher rating and maybe we just ordered badly but everything was a little heavy. We shared an app of spinach dip and egg rolls between 3 and then a pizza and salad between 2 but ended up taking half of it home. It served for lunch next day but again, was a little rich for my tastes. Cocktails (alcoholic and non) were 5 star delish!

I just had a terrible asian chicken salad there! not enough chicken and dressing,not taste at all! ROY a very RUDE manager!!! denied to replace the salad even when another manager said that I could have another one... I will never go back! there are so many others good places around that same area! TERRIBLE!!! food and attitude.
