I'm pretty picky when it comes to food... Believe it or not, but a CPK messed up my simple "pepperoni and cheese only" request once and I hadn't been back in years until this past weekend. Pretty good...and they managed to get the "pepperoni and cheese only" request...on point. We ordered curbside, which was pretty great being that it was ready when we got there, we were able to park in one of 5 available curbside spots without hassle, and it was still hot when we got home.  I give em a thumbs up.

Came in for a very quick bite at 7:15 pm on a Saturday. We were seated right away and had our meal (BBQ Chopped Salad and Jamaican Jerk Pizza) finished and paid for by 7:45. Hats off to our server, Ryan, who was quick, courteous, cute and as good as they come. Thanks, CPK & Ryan!

Sometimes I wish I was 10 years of age or under.  That way I could order the kid's menu Macaroni and Cheese instead of eating half of my daughter's serving.  That has to be the cheesiest, creamiest, yummiest slop I've ever had.  Anyway... Since we can't order that for ourselves and have to order "grown up" food (dammit!), the wife and I always take advantage of the great pricing CPK has on their bottled wines.  Not necessarily the actual price, per se, but, you can order a whole bottle for a couple of bucks more than 3 glasses.  That's kind of unheard of.  Usually it comes in around the same price as 4 glasses (or more!).   It makes Daddy feel a lot better about not being able to order a kid's MnC, although I still sneak in a few bites. BTW, we love it here.  We're treated like royalty for some reason.  They even comped us a meal once for no reason other than just being good customers.  We tip good too, so, maybe that helps. :-)

We have eaten here tons of times and always get take out.  They have messed up our take out orders countless times!  Tonight was the last straw.  We are no longer ordering from CPK Marina Del Rey.  We were given 2 dishes (with someone else's name on them!) that had seafood in them, which 2 people in our family are allergic to!  Our pizza wasn't even warm and we live less than 10 min from this restaurant.  We didn't even get to eat as a family since hubby spent so much time driving back and forth due to their errors!   When I was pregnant they messed up my order, when we had a dinner w/ extended family they messed up my order, we had friends over and they messed up our order, I could go on and on.   It's ridiculous that they can't get their take out orders right!  We really like their food and our kids do too but no more!  We are boycotting CPK.     ***BEWARE, IF YOU ORDER TAKEOUT FROM THE MDR CPK YOU BETTER CHECK YOUR ORDER THOROUGHLY BEFORE DRIVING OFF.***

Went to CPK in Marina last night for happy hour with a friend and was so impressed with our server - Logan.  She was funny, sweet and attentive.  The food was great and the mango sangria was delish.  Parking on the side of the restaurant is easiest.  I'll definitely be back.  Thanks Logan!

It's a CPK with a fresh face.  It's a mob scene at lunch, but they do their best to make you happy.  This is a restaurant that's good for groups, kids and anyone who has too many differing tastes to accommodate at one table. I am not a devoted CPK fan, but if this is your bailiwick, then you'll be right at home.  You can call in an order and pick it up curbside or at the take-out counter.

CPK is a great place to eat.  The food is very high quality and the service quick and friendly.  Every CPK is the exact same in every respect, which is good because you know you are getting good food, good service, and a nice atmosphere. If you have never had CPK before, you MUST try it at least once.  I don't know a single person who doesn't like CPK.

I've been eating at CPK, since the early 1990's.  I have been to many different locations and enjoyed mostly all of them.  However now I'm starting to change my mind.  This past Sunday I visited the Marina Del Rey location and was very disappointed.  The salad (Thai Crunch) was good as usual but, everything else was horrible.  The pizza was under cooked as well as the chicken on it.  The bread was aweful, the butter was extremely hard which tore the bread in half.  And my iced tea was watered down.  And last but not least...the service was bad.  I'm really disappointed to see this restaurant that I used to like go down hill like this.
I love this CPK. The service is always great at this location. I love the Grilled Vegetable Salad here and the White Pizza.

Since we were in the area for work, I went to CPK in Marina Del Rey with my co-worker for lunch. You can choose between the heated outdoor patio seating or regular indoor seating. They were packed either way, so we opted for the indoor seating since it was a bit chilly and windy. Their menu is gigantic, with a lot of different choices: appetizers, salads, pizzas, pastas, sandwiches and other plates. They have one full page with over 20 different pizzas. My co-worker said they have really good pizza and I did hesitate a little because I have tried a couple of restaurants in Pasadena that also have pizza in their name, and make some pretty bad pizza, but they have this chain in NYC too, so it can't be that bad. Plus, the pasta would have been too filling and I would have fallen into a food coma for the rest of the work day! I did like how there were many different topping combinations and managed to narrow down my choices to either the white pizza or the wild mushroom. Both were $11.49 I think and most of the pizzas were in the $10-$15 range. I opted for the wild mushroom pizza which had 3 types of mushroom, mozzarella and fontina, and a mushroom walnut pesto. You can add chicken, but I love mushrooms just by themselves on pizza. The pizza was a good size for one person, about 9 inches in diameter. It was thin crust style so it was not heavy. There was a lot of mushroom and pretty good flavor. My co-worker opted for the BBQ chicken pizza, which on the menu is advertised as their most popular pizza. I had never had any type of BBQ pizza and would never have thought the flavors would mesh well, but it was really good! Overall, I have to say, the pizza is pretty good for a chain store. Sadly, this is the 2nd best pizza I've had in LA thus far (yes I know, from a chain!!). The handful of other pizza joints I've tried here have been crap (with the exception of Bollini's). I did think the food was overpriced and the service was okay. I guess they were busy, but we had to flag down our waiter for refills on our drinks. At places like this (which I equate to applebee's or TGI Fridays) they usually check up on you once during the meal to see how you are doing!

This past Saturday we went to see my Aunt who lives in West LA and had back surgery a couple weeks ago. She wanted to go to CPK so off we went. Once we got there we were seated right away and were promptly greeted by our server who quickly took our drink orders. We then proceeded to chat for awhile and decide what to order. My Mom and Aunt ordered the Moroccan chicken salad (1/2 order) which was very good but was missing the beets (my favorite). My boyfriend and I split a pesto chicken thin crust pizza and BBQ chicken salad. All were fresh and brought out quickly. Not the healthiest of lunches but it was quite good. We then walked around the shopping center which had BCBG, White House Black Market, and a couple of other cute stores. Very clean and very shoppable. All in all quite a nice day out with my Mom and Aunt.

We went to this CPK for my niece's post graduation celebration. The wait was toooooooo long. The service was pitiful. It was a very hot day and I never received a refill on my beverage. It was a large group and they managed to charge us for things we didn't even order. I would never recommend or go back to this place.

food=B+ service=B ambience=B- value=C+ lunch with a friend. today, we ordered the chicken pesto pizza and the fish tacos. both were good. ive always been a fan of cpk. this one in the marina is a good one. good service, consistently good food, nice environment. i gotta say though, the food here is pretty pricey considering what you get. but its a nice place to grab lunch or dinner. no huge complaints here.

Someone call the popo because no one in this place knows how to drive.  People were backing up into each other left and right.   Other than the parking lot being a mess, the CPK menu is also all over the place.  Since when did the menu expand to Jerry's Deli-like proportions?  Anyways,  I was in a weird mood and tried to be "different", so I ordered the Gorgonzola pizza on honey wheat with pears and the fried artichoke heart appetizer.  The pizza had a salad ON TOP?  I guess I don't read carefully.  I thought it would be on the side, but nope the lettuce and dressing were covering my pizza.  Strange.  My friend was like "It all mixes in your stomach anyways."  Touche.  I ate it up without complaining.  Next time, I'll get a four cheese and tomato, but CPK gets points for creativity.  Also, the artichoke things were crunchy and not greasy.  Plus my friend ate his Thai bbq pizza in 3 minutes so I know he fully enjoyed his dish.

CPK is alright, but nothing amazing. Many other family-owned restaurants have better versions of similar dishes at the same prices, all in nicer settings. I guess it's the ambiance that kills me most...it feels somewhat like a cafeteria.
Hahahahaha. $10 to deliver. The food might be good but that delivery fee is too ridiculous to find out.

I went here for pizza pretty late on a Sunday.  I ordered their margherita pizza and was pretty happy with it.  Wherever I get pizza, I get it so I can compare how places make it.  So far, I like CPK's the best.  The service is pretty friendly and it's a tad pricey for pizza I guess.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I should would. Or even better, a - 5 star rating is what they deserve. Had a terrible experience when picking up a phone order. First, upon arrival was not greeted properly. After paying for our order and tipping the attendant, she said that the order will be ready shortly. 15 minutes later we were still sitting and waiting for a simple SALAD that was ordered half an hour prior our arrival over the phone. Nobody came to check on us or give us an update on the order. 20-30 min go by after the point we have been told the order will be ready shortly and I go and ask what the status is. The girl who processed the order lets me know that the salad has been taken by a waiter by mistake and that they will make a new one. SERIOUSLY?! And you couldn't come and apologize for the wait?! I ask to speak to a manger and when a lady comes and I explain the rudeness of her employee she has an even worse off attitude. What is wrong with these people?! Never eating at that place again! Didn't even offer a free appetizer or an apology for the mistake... I love CPK but this location is a major NO NO

Don't go here!  Fraudulent transactions occurred on my credit card immediately after I used it at this CPK.  When I called management to let them know, they didn't even apologize and said they were positive it wasn't anyone on their staff (yeah right!).  I am 100% sure that CPK was responsible for the stolen credit card number.  I will never go here again.

What a big disappointment for that location! I have been going there for years (used to be kids friendly too) and used to love to go there with my girlfriends for a light lunch with friends and family in the evening. They had a nice menu for kids. Well, it all changed on November 2011. we took our little girl there for her birthday (her request) told the hosted it was her birthday, when I noticed the our server was a little off...he did not offer a drink with the kids meal, bread was stale like it has been sitting in the refrigerator for days (I would not give it to my guests). I approached the server to let him know it is my daughter's 6th birthday...nothing...he had at least 5 people with him to sing to a table by us but only brought an ice cream for her (did not ask me what I wanted) and said "happy birthday sweetie"... just him ....not even her name...I believe it is under new management (at least I hope that will explain it) but it was just bad. I have not been back ever since...I prefer to spend my $50.00 on other chain restaurants such as cheese cake factory where I get good service and good food. I even sent a respond to their corporate office back in November and did not hear back...oh well.

i received a gift card for cpk so we decided to go for lunch.  this cpk is located in a shopping center and has ample parking.  we arrived a few minutes before the place opened at 1130am.  there were a couple of people already there waiting by the door.  well, once we got in and were seated, our server came to us and introduced himself as matt; however, i noticed that his nametag said, 'paco from mexico city'.  he must've seen the look on my face because then he explained that he is a new employee there and didn't have a nametag of his own as of yet.  anywho, we ordered the cabo crab cakes for our appetizer.  those were good, but the four little crab cakes weren't enough.  our entrees were good and filling.  the atmosphere was nice.  they have indoor and outdoor seating.  the restrooms were clean.  the only complaint i have is the bread they serve.  it could be sooo much better.  i suggest that at least they put the bread in the oven for a bit and serve it warm. so, the amount of the gift card covered our appetizer, entrees, drinks, and dessert.  i couldn't eat another bite so i asked for my dessert to go.  i didn't get to taste it though, because on our drive back home, we saw a man on the off-ramp who was holding a sign that said, "HUNGRY".  i decided to give the man my dessert.  my bf asked me twice if i was sure i wanted to give it up.  i had an untouched dessert just waiting to be eaten.  the man was hungry now.  i can wait to have some dessert later. cpk - i'll be back to try your red velvet cake.

Horrible service for take out.  Don't expect them to have your food ready when you get there. I ordered their famous Barbecue Chicken Pizza over the phone and reception girl said it'll be ready in 20 mins at the Curb Side. When I got there 20 mins later, I called and let them know I'm at the Curb Side parking. The same girl who took the order picked up the phone and said she'll be right out.  After 15 mins of waiting, someone finally came out and asked if we're waiting for something. I told him my order and he went back in the restaurant BUT never came back out!! I waited another 5 mins and I decided to go in and pick it up myself. The girl at the take-out counter, standing next to the guy who asked about my order at the Curb-Side parking, said it still wasn't ready 40 mins after the order. She told me "we're busy tonight, it's not ready" with a bitchy tone and wasn't apologetic about it.  Horrible service. Never will go back again.
